name: Python-Sp16
body:
All workshops will be held in the EWS computer laboratory, L440 Digital Computer Laboratory.  There is no sign-up for this series—walk-ins are welcome and encouraged!

L440 DCL is a little tricky to find if you haven't been there before.  It's located in the basement, and can be accessed by going down the main staircase in DCL and turning right.

![](./img/map-l440.png)

For most of the lessons, we will require outside modules.  We will provide a Python *virtual environment* in class, which will run on the EWS machine and let you access all of the modules required.  [Anaconda](https://store.continuum.io/cshop/anaconda/) is an excellent Python distribution for your personal machine.

**Please find any necessary setup directions for today's workshop below.**

# Introduction to Python
#### Feb. 16, Noon–2:00 p.m.

-   [Exercises](./lessons/intro-exercises.md)
-   [Data set #1](./lessons/data/microarray.csv)
-   [Data set #2](./lessons/data/wheres-waldo-locations.csv)


# Scientific Computing (`numpy`, `scipy`)
#### Feb. 23, Noon–2:00 p.m. (`numpy`)
#### Feb. 24, Noon–2:00 p.m. (`scipy`)

-   Open a new Terminal and run the setup code below to prepare your EWS machine to run our Python lesson today.  This will download the data we will work with and the NumPy notebook.  (You can copy and paste the entire block at once.)
    
        source /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/bin/activate /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/
        cd
        cd Desktop
        git clone https://github.com/uiuc-cse/python-sp16.git
        cd python-sp16
        jupyter notebook

-   Find the `numpy-scipy.ipynb` notebook and open it in the browser.

-   To execute a code cell, select it and press `Shift`+`Enter`.


# Data Analytics (`pandas`, `seaborn`)
#### Mar. 1, Noon–2:00 p.m.

-   Download the following files to your Desktop:
    
    -   [`pandas-working.ipynb`](./lessons/pandas-working.ipynb)

-   Open a new Terminal and run the setup code below to prepare your EWS machine to run our Python lesson today.  This will download the data we will work with and the Pandas notebook.  (You can copy and paste the entire block at once.)
    
        source /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/bin/activate /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/
        cd ; cd Desktop
        jupyter notebook

-   Find the `pandas-working.ipynb` notebook and open it in the browser.

-   To execute a code cell, select it and press `Shift`+`Enter`.


# Plotting (`matplotlib`)
#### Mar. 8, Noon–2:00 p.m.

-   Download the following files to your Desktop folder:
    
    -   [`matplotlib.ipynb`](./lessons/matplotlib.ipynb)

-   Open a new Terminal and run the setup code below to prepare your EWS machine to run our Python lesson today.  This will download the data we will work with and the Pandas notebook.  (You can copy and paste the entire block at once.)
    
        source /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/bin/activate /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/
        cd ; cd Desktop
        jupyter notebook

-   Find the `matplotlib.ipynb` notebook and open it in the browser.

-   To execute a code cell, select it and press `Ctrl`+`Enter`.


# Intermediate topics in Python
#### Mar. 15, Noon–2:00 p.m.

-   Download the following files to your Desktop folder:
    
    -   [`oop-intro.ipynb`](./lessons/oop-intro.ipynb)

-   Open a new Terminal and run the setup code below to prepare your EWS machine to run our Python lesson today.  This will download the data we will work with and the Pandas notebook.  (You can copy and paste the entire block at once.)
    
        source /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/bin/activate /class/cs101/etc/venv/cse/
        cd ; cd Desktop
        jupyter notebook

-   Find the `oop-intro.ipynb` notebook and open it in the browser.

-   To execute a code cell, select it and press `Ctrl`+`Enter` (or `Shift`+`Enter` to advance).


# Machine Learning (scikit-learn)
#### Mar. 29, Noon–2:00 p.m.


# Error handling (`pdb`, etc.)
#### Apr. 5, Noon–2:00 p.m.


# Optimizing numerics (Cython, Numba, `f2py`)
#### Apr. 12, Noon–2:00 p.m.


# Jupyter notebook (formerly IPython)
#### Apr. 19, Noon–2:00 p.m.


# Considerations in making a major project
#### Apr. 26, Noon–2:00 p.m.

This workshop will cover creating your own modules, working with multiple files, and other factors to take into account when going beyond a single script.
